main_definition: Showing likes or supports one thing more than another, often unfairly.

meanings_and_examples.example: I have a partial view of the painting from this angle.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Showing favoritism towards one person, group, or thing over others.
meanings_and_examples.example: The judge's decision was seen as partial because he favored his brother's company in the lawsuit.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Divided; consisting of parts that are not joined together.
meanings_and_examples.example: A partial denture is used to replace a few missing teeth by joining artificial pieces together.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to, affecting only part of an organism or system.
meanings_and_examples.example: Partial solar eclipse occurs when the moon covers only part of the sun's disk as seen from Earth.
